intro: Synmeria crinifera, commonly known as the silky tree, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive silky, hairy leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, hard seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its unique appearance makes it a popular ornamental plant in horticulture.
